main event: A civilian man reported sighting a brilliant white light in the sky from his third-floor apartment in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania on August 6, 1952.
interesting points: The light was described as disc-shaped, luminous, and approximately 20-25 feet in diameter, climbing rapidly at a 500 angle.
The object disappeared from view for approximately three to four seconds, with no further details or estimate of altitude or speed given by the observer.
The weather at the time of the sighting was clear with approximately ten miles visibility.
No sound or exhaust was reported from the object, and the observer was noted to be of average intelligence and not excessively imaginative.
The report is believed to check closely in time and description with other reports from the area.
witnesses: civilian man, 2d Lt. John E. Sharrock, USAF
